custom_fields.key_topics: Mendelian analysis, Pedigree analysis, Chromosomes, Alleles, Genetic linkage and chromosome mapping, population genetics, complex traits, bacterial genetics, functional genomics, recombination, cancer genetics
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: Students need to have a basic understanding of molecular biology and biochemistry, such as they will receive from the department's Modern Biology course, as well as a basic foundation in quantitative analysis and probability (preferably a statistics course)
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Students are assessed using weekly homework assignments, four semester exams, a final, and a project.
custom_fields.goals: Students learn to1. Analyze inheritance of simple and complex traits based on Mendelian principles. 2. Recognize and quantify linkage relationships. 3. Derive basic parameters of linkage and selection from population data. 4. Explain fundamental mechanistic features of mutation, DNA repair, and recombination, and apply these principles analytically. 5. Recognize and explain mechanisms of DNA transfer in bacteria and phage. 6. Interpret basic features of gene regulation and its effects on genetic interaction. 7. Interpret features of development and tumorigenesis in view of principles of gene regulation and gene interaction.8. Explain current approaches for analysis of gene function based on bioinformatic and functional genomic methods, and apply this knowledge to make predictions and design experimental workflows.
custom_fields.relevance: The targeted student population includes students majoring in Biology, Psychology, and Neuroscience. Genetics is a foundational topic for all areas of biology. It is particularly important for those entering the health professions, as genetics plays a deep role in disease phenotypes.
custom_fields.learning_resources: Students will use the textbook, "Genetics: Genes, Genomes, and Evolution" from Oxford University Press. This textbook has an optional online companion website. In addition, the instructor provides curated links to specific youtube videos.

long_desc: The mechanisms of transmission of inherited traits in viruses, bacteria, fungi, plants and animals are discussed. Molecular mechanisms of gene expression and gene regulation are analyzed. Recombinant DNA and its applications in genetic analysis, biotechnology, forensics, agriculture, medicine, and the pharmaceutical industry are presented. Special topics in human genetics are considered, such as the genetics of cancer. Principles and methods for the study of developmental genetics, population genetics and complex traits are also introduced.

prereqs.text: (03-151 at least D) or (03-121 at least D)
